name: Sarah McLachlan
description: '''Sarah Ann McLachlan''' {{Post-nominals|OC|OBC|country=CAN}} (born January 28, 1968) is a Canadian singer-songwriter. As of 2015, she had sold over 40 million albums worldwide. McLachlan's best-selling album is ''[[Surfacing (album)|Surfacing]]'' (1997), for which she won two [[Grammy Award]]s (out of four nominations) and four [[Juno Award]]s. She has won three Grammy and twelve [[Juno Awards]] in total, and is a member of the [[Canadian Music Hall of Fame]] and the [[Canadian Songwriters Hall of Fame]]. McLachlan founded the [[Lilith Fair]] tour, which showcased female musicians.
